title: Cincinnati Prehospital Stroke Severity Scale (CP-SSS)
description: Predicts large vessel occlusion (LVO) and severe stroke in patients with stroke symptoms

parameters.name: level_of_consciousness_questions
parameters.description: Patient's ability to answer level of consciousness questions correctly

parameters.name: following_commands
parameters.description: Patient's ability to follow simple commands

parameters.name: arm_holding_ability
parameters.description: Patient's ability to hold arm up for 10 seconds

result.name: cp_sss_score
result.description: Cincinnati Prehospital Stroke Severity Scale score

ranges.description: LVO and severe stroke less likely
ranges.interpretation: Low probability of large vessel occlusion and severe stroke (NIHSS <15)
High probability of large vessel occlusion and severe stroke (NIHSS ≥15)

references: Katz BS, McMullan JT, Sucharew H, Adeoye O, Broderick JP. Design and validation of a prehospital scale to predict stroke severity: the Cincinnati Prehospital Stroke Severity Scale. Stroke. 2015 Jun;46(6):1508-12.
McMullan JT, Katz B, Broderick J, Schmit P, Sucharew H, Adeoye O. Prospective prehospital evaluation of the Cincinnati stroke triage assessment tool. Prehosp Emerg Care. 2017 Jan-Feb;21(1):68-75.

Zhao H, Coote S, Pesavento L, Churilov L, Dewey HM, Davis SM, et al. Large vessel occlusion scales increase delivery to endovascular centers without excessive harm from misclassifications. Stroke. 2017 Mar;48(3):568-573.
formula: Sum of points: Conjugate gaze deviation (0-2 pts) + LOC questions (0-2 pts) + Following commands (0-2 pts) + Arm holding (0-1 pt)
notes: Designed for use by emergency medical services personnel
Predicts severe stroke (NIHSS ≥15) with 89% sensitivity and 78% specificity at cut-point ≥2
Helps guide decisions for direct transport to comprehensive stroke centers
Should not replace clinical judgment or delay treatment
Requires immediate neurological consultation for positive screens
